values: This is the worst and largest tropical storm in history. Super Typhoon Tip achieved maximum sustained winds of 190mph and had a barometric pressure at the surface of 870mb. The storm bands were 1350 miles across.

Its great hearing the congratulations from everyone, as if years of self doubt were obliterated in 15 minutes.

But I think I found the black lining on my silver cloud... working at 3 am. Not being at work at three, but starting then. Waking up at 1:30 am as everyone is going to sleep to first make coffee and begin the daily grind. Speaking of which...

It'll take a few days to get figure out and get used to this sleeping arrangement.

Wish me luck, cause I have no clue what I'm doing.

Ok I know I dont post often, but at least Ill try to make it worth my while. I have  a new job! Im going to a production assistant for the sunrise newscast for WESH2 in Orlando. It was surreal getting the job. Ive been interning at the studio for a month and on a whim I said I was interested in the open position. The Assistant News Director interviewed me and I was walking out of there with my own security badge. I keep looking at it and I dont believe it. As if I were going to walk in on Monday and here everyone laugh at the joke they had played. But its real, I signed the W4s...

Well, I havent posted anything about this until I found out how it would play out and now that it has I can come out with it!

I have an internship with WESH NBC 2 working in their Election coverage. Im not sure if Ill be writing copy for the website or working with a field reporter. Either way, itll be very cool. 

Friday morning I go in for 'orientation' and then I work three days a week. 

My first step towards a real job and career. Im so excited!

Try Mozilla's Firefox 0.92 browser. You can even include a built in, live journal updater. Like I'm using now. I know Im such a tech geek. BTW, On my vacation to Israel this time, I proposed! On our one year, we went to Ein Gedi, an oasis in the Negev and while we were at the waterfall I 'popped' the question. She said yes. We're planning for after our first BS, if that ever comes. Speaking of which, I have a meeting before the readmissions committee on Tuesday, July 20th at 9am to present a case for my re entry into UCF.

Sorry, but the last few months of my life have been thankfully busy. Where do I begin? well Ill start here...

School: Now im sitting at UCF with Michal. I have class in little less than an hour. My plans for reentry to UCF have been put on hold till summer in light of a lack of time in getting a paper work together. But I did attend my first semester in over a year at Valencia and am currently enrolled for 9 hours there. 

Girlfriend: Well things are going just fine with her. I've been working for her dad on mondays at the flea market and have elsewise been living her family who seem to like me well enough. I cant say I have any complaints. 

Work: Well Im back at fast food this time as a management trainee at taco bell. Its paying ok, about as much as Convergys was without the benefits or air condition desk job. I dont know how long it will last though, its been almost 3 months. 

Politics: you know I had to chime in with the primaries getting under way next week. If your a dem then you should be paying attention to the field especially since florida determines a large number of the delegates. My money is on Clark, but Ill discuss that later. 

Thats all Im writing for now, ill expand myself more in the upcoming days.

Well its been almost a month since Ive been to LJ and I thought it was time to do an update. 

Now Im sitting at the pool at my apartment complex. (I love unsecured wireless internet connections). I have about an hour before I leave to go to Lake Mary. Tonight we're going out with her friend and her beau. Double date fun. 

Ok the serious stuff. 

Her mother went and talked to the rabbi and apparently I am not Jewish. Because my mother had converted, I was born a goy. Well obviously disappointed (I have considered my self jewish all my life) it simply means I need to do a conversion. It'll take about a year, and will give me a chance to learn more about the religion. It will need to be an orthodox conversion, because we want it to be accepted by Israel in case we decide to move there (A strong possibility because I want to write out of a major international city and Jerusalem qualifies).

This coming weekend, not the current, is her little brothers bar mitzvah and will we be glad its over. OY. Its a 4 day affair. On top of that, her father is coming into town for it. Thats right, while Ive spent the last 3 months practically living at their house I have not spent anytime with Daddy and every guy looks forward to the moment he gets to 'bond' with his girlfriends father. 

In about two weeks my exile from Convergys will be over. While I would not have wanted to return to the company my purgation at Target has radically changed my point of view. Hopefully Ill be able to save enough for school and for a trip to Israel next summer with my mother and her family. Thatll be around 4 grand. 

Not much else to say. The fact that I havent been around should atest that I am more than occupied in my new relationship and loving every moment of it.

I just watched my first episode of Queer eye for the straight guy and omg! It was this cute guy trying to propose to his Armenian girlfriend. I totally need a group of of gay men to help coordinate my proposal to Michal. I totally could not have come up with all of that stuff. 

Does anybody know a group of fags of leisure who can reshape me into a stylized cultured hottie?

so yeah, going through my finances made me want to shoot myself again. Its the begining of August and I havent saved anything. On top of that I need to save 600 a month from now on to afford UCF in January. Thats of course in addition to the 400 Ill need at Valencia this fall. To make matters worse my job is paying me about 125 a week, or 500 a month, which wouldnt even cut it if i didnt have a car payment. In a week and a half Fridays should start taking apps and hopefully i can make some money there. I used to average around 10 an hour after tips and with that kind of pay I come close to making all of my dreams happen. 

in the mean time its getting on my nerves and im taking it out on the people around me. which is only making me more aggrivated. I was supposed to see Michally tonight but apparently Ive blown that chance. 

This is the end, Beautiful friend
This is the end, My only friend, the end
Of our elaborate plans, the end
Of everything that stands, the end
No safety or surprise, the end
I'll never look into your eyes...again

In a conversation with Michal she told me her mother would appreciate it more if I were Jewish not Catholic. I took that as an insult, Im definitely not Catholic. But that raised the issue of whether I am jewish. Ultimately Im going to the Rabbi tomorrow to sort out the ruling but Im pretty sure I am. 
<lj-cut>
Here's the story as I understand it now. A long time ago in a land far away my grandfather had become ill. His dieing wish was for my grandmother a christian to convert so they could be buried together. Well fortunately he didnt pass away for a long time. Some time later they had to children, my uncle then my mother. Under jewish law my mother was born jewish. Well later in her life my mother decided to convert to Catholicism. Michal claims that because my mother converted before I was born I am not jewish. I countered with halakhic law which says if youre jewish youre jewish, its like the mafia you cant leave. 

This is of course related to our relationship. Though she hasnt made a strong case for it I know she wants a jewish wedding. And she has told me on occasion that dating a jewish boy makes life easier because she doesnt need to explain why she doesnt eat crab et al. Her mother is trying to be a bit more observant of shabbat, at least having a shabbas dinner on Friday. A couple of weeks ago we had kiddush and Michal suggested that we have shabbas dinner together, something a bit easier when school starts and she is no longer working Friday nights. 

This raised the question at least to me, how jewish should I be? Should I weat TziTzi(fringes)? maybe or Peyas(curls)? probably not. Would I observe shabbas dinner? probably. What about strict prohibitions?(flip no switch, push no button, drive no car)? thats tough. I guess this is an issue for me because I grew up around so many 'Cafeteria Catholics' who claimed to be Catholic but picked and chose what they wanted to observe from the religion. In my mind (and hers too, she was raised Orthodox) Orthodox law is proper Judaism and anything less would make me hypocritical. The problem remains can I integrate jewish law into my current lifestyle? Obviously a part of me wants to or else this wouldnt be an issue. 
</lj-cut>
Maybe I should go to the rabbi and ask for help preparing for a bar mitzvah. I know its a bit late, but it would solidify my position. This is something I will discuss with her more when I see her tomorrow evening. 

Oh yeah, she told me she wants a wedding on the beach at sunset. I suggested the west coast of Florida or Israel because the sun sets on the west.
I would seriously try to think of something witty to preface this with but anything I say just pales in comparison to the actual story

so... I went to the ATTWireless store down the street to check out that new Nokia 3650. While playing with its features I casually mentioned to the sales guy that Amazon was offering it for free. He went online to verify my claim and offered to match it! With no deposit or rebate forms or anything. Just a one year deal and I walked out with a new $300 phone. 

Features: Camera, Video Camera with RealOne, GSM TriBand, GPRS, Infared, Bluetooth, Java apps, Organizer, Loudspeaker, 4096 color screen. Oh yeah... and it should make calls. 

I say should because the service hasnt activated yet. 

All in all, im amused with my new toy.

Ok, Im having some issues with cellular service, but arent we all? This is whats going on. Last Saturday I got a new phone from Cingular. Its a T306 and it came with a free camera. The service plan is 500 anytime 5,000 n/w for $39.95. Another 6.95 for 1MB data and 2.99 for 100 text messages. 49.89 monthly. The term is 2 years. I have 15 days from date of purchase to change my mind and Ill be out the $18 activation. Amazon is having a cellular sale. Theyre offering through ATTWireless the Nokia 3650. This phone has built in still/video camera. Its bluetooth capable. Expandable memory with mmc slot. The service plan is $39.95 for 600 anytime and unlimited N/W. 7.95 for 1MB data. 25 text messages are 1.99. 49.89 monthly The term is 1 year. In addition to the ATT plan, Amazon is also offering the Nokia with TMobile. Their plan is 39.99 for 600 min with unlimited N/W. They offer 500 text messages for 2.99 and 1MB data for 2.99 (3.00 per extra MB). 45.97 monthly. And if that wasnt enough, Amazon is also offering the T300 through TMobile. From what I can tell its very similiar to the one I have now. The price? $100 back after rebates. The phone is 79.99 so Im still ahead 20 bucks (or after the loss of activation back to even). Why do this? Cheaper data and txt messaging... Now those of you who have called my cell at my house know how bad the service is, however since going to the GSM phone it has been remarkably better. I have been told good things about ATT's service but my experience shows its just where you are and where the deadspots are, all carriers have them. The pro/con argument breaks down like this. The Nokia has a large display so it is big itself. Im used to the 7160, but I think this is bigger still. The SonyEricsson is rather small, if youre familiar with their line its about the same size at the T68i. The video feature of the Nokia is also lagging at 15fps (full motion is 30fps). I do like the upgradeable memory in the Nokia (comes with 16MB). Cingular's MMS service wont be available till December, whereas Att's mMode service is currently running. TMobile is a bit cheaper on the text messaging and data services. I just havent really heard anything abou their service coverage. What should I do? oh yeah... the cost of the Nokia is $300 upfront with $300 mail in rebates (allow 8-10wks for processing).

I also got an application for Valencia. By Monday I will have it filled out and will call STA about having my transcript mailed up. Ok, im soliciting ideas from the general public for a date tomorrow night. 

This is what Ive thought of so far: 

Picnic, either at the beach or at a park. Downside, 50% chance of rain or better depending on location. 

Theatre, local play groups etc. Downside, Sunday shows are usually 2pm or thereabouts. 

Movies, 28 days, Charlies Angels, Hulk are all showing. Downside, done the movies thing twice already and she hasnt expressed interest in any of those movies, maybe Finding Nemo.

Comedy Club, Sak or Improv. Downside, we tried Improv before and theyre 21+ except for Friday night. Sak isnt showing Sunday. 

Dance Clun, pulse pounding techno music. Downside, she doesnt seem to be much into dancing, and sunday isnt a big clubbing night. 

Night home, cook dinner and curl up to watch Casablanca. Romantic. Downside, can be construed as boring, would take effort to carry the evening and prevent boredom. 

Can you think of anything else? This is a democracy (for the time being) so your votes count!

Unfortunately I will forever be inextricably bound to the rest of humanity, passing between us countless tears and joy. And in that spirit I write this passage. 
<lj-cut>
Last night I was struck by a crisis of identity. I played out each thought to its logical conclusion in an effort to extrapolate an idea of self. What follows is a reproduction of that fevered night and hopefully an ultimate conclusion. 

The process began while I was thinking on Michal. I should relate that truly this began as a dissection of my sexuality. I was examining my intentions for bringing up the matter and further forcing the issue upon her when the obvious answer struck me. Self destruction before annihilation. That is, if I sabotage the relationship at this point it saves me trouble of emotional hardship when I cant face the effort later on. But that was too simple.

I was led of course then to thoughts of 'fitting in', truly an existential thought. The dilemma of alienation, the feeling of showing up late to the party after all of the guests have started mingling and you find yourself alone, that feeling has gripped me all too well. I argued with myself on a simply sexual level I fit in nowhere. Someone would always find fault with me and shun that which they were uncomfortable with, thus finally shunning me. At best in tandem I would find a group to act as that singular friend but no person to really understand the joy and heartache as I did. And I felt that Michal would be no different. 

Mind you that I had not forgotten the existential birth of this tragedy so I soon returned my thoughts to it. The real folly of that previous passage was that it belied the fundamental maxims. That is, it was simply an attempt to cast archetypal labels upon myself through the skewed eyes of external views, utterly betraying the simple declaration, "You are-- your life, and nothing else". I can not will myself to be a better man; to be stronger, more loving, more caring. I can only make the real decisions that come along, and thus look back on my life as a series of choices whose sum is my essence. 

The final fear that gripped me as I acquiesced in this was the lack of direction it entails. Without the will to advance oneself, without the will to power one meanders through life a victim of his own abnegation. Ultimately I fear I will become Sartre's Garcin, cursed my life to spend it justifying my actions, to cool my heart when fever strikes. If I am nothing more than my life, what absolution is there for decisions already made? If I am not my will, but my deeds have I already been condemned? 

There is a conclusion. I must give Jean Paul his due, but Nietzsche can not be ignored. Freedom without the will to power, without fate is diseased. And I can not in the Dionysian spirit write off this world as diseased or a drawing room hell. For those who will it, joy is there, and I decide to grasp it!

</lj-cut>
Which of Jean-Paul Sartre's plays are you?

The Supreme Court ruled today in favor of striking down anti-homosexual sodomy laws when they heard Lawrence v Texas. The move by the Supreme Court strikes down sodomy laws in the 13 states that still had them. The decision was handed down 6-3 with Justice Kennedy writing the affirmative with Justices Stevens, Souer, Ginsberg, and Breyer consenting. Justice O'Conner also consented but wrote her own reasoning for doing so. The dissention was given by Scalia saying "the court has largely signed on to the so-called homosexual agenda," while adding that he has "nothing against homosexuals". Agreeing with him were Justices Rehnquist and Thomas. While hearing Lawrence v Texas, they also revisted a 1986 decision on an antisodomy law in Georgia repealing their stance on that law. Since the 1986 decision Georgia had repealed the antisodomy law on its own. The story of Lawrence v Texas begins in 1998 when police responding to a false disturbance report broke into the apartment of John Lawrence and found him having sex with Tyron Gardner. The men were arrested and fined $200 for 'deviate sexual intercourse'. The Lambda Legal Council brought the case before the court arguing it violated citizen's right to due process. Of course, traditionalist groups were up in arms over the decision fearing that it could lead to gay marriages and as Jan LaRue, chief counsel for Concerned Women for America, a conservative group, said "If there's no rational basis for prohibiting same-sex sodomy by consenting adults, then state laws prohibiting prostitution, adultery, bigamy, and incest are at risk,". She further added "No doubt, homosexual activists will try to bootstrap this decision into a mandate for same-sex marriage. Any attempt to equate sexual perversion with the institution that is the very foundation of society is as baseless as this ruling.". Irregardless of conservative groups arguing that this decision will be the breakdown of the morality of the community Justice O'Conner in her decsion wrote "A law branding one class of persons as criminal solely based on the state's moral disapproval of that class and the conduct associated with that class runs contrary to the values of the Constitution and the Equal Protection Clause, under any standard of review." To read the ruling click here. This is an acrobat file.

That chapter is closed, but this is still being written. I daresay there might be a happy ending after all.

Ok, what went down yesterday?

Spent the afternoon with Michal's parents and her, shopping around the Altamonte mall. Unfortunately my inability the last week to get any sleep had taken its toll on me and I was pretty out of it. 

Earlier in the day I had left my car at Aristocrat for some repairs. Turns out the rattling in my engine had been a bad ball joint and they would want 625 dollars to fix it. This is in addition to my busted ac compressor($?), front grill ($700) and windshield wiper pump ($80). The latter 3 I can live without, but the ball joint is a must. I just dont have 625 nor will I any time soon. Even if I saved all my money from work and ignored my bills and other responsibilities it would take about a month to have the money. 

The dealership suggested I file a supplemental claim on the original insurance claim that covered the work on the car. If that works it should cover everything and my car would be in full working order. Currently Im holding with the insurance company. Been holding since before I started typing this. "Thank you for calling Amstar Insurance Company, your call will be answered by the next available representative". If that doesnt work I dont know what ill do. I have a feeling this is going to be a long battle. 

And back to Michal. I told her at the mall I was probably going to take a day to myself for recouperation because I was feeling drained. To say she didnt seem happy about this would be an understatement. I just dont want to be an emotional vacuum around her, or around anyone for that matter. But Im feeling better so maybe ill call her before she leaves for work.

So far I havent found anything wrong. I even told her I may be going to DC and she said we could keep in contact by phone and get to know each other like that.

An old fashioned romance is definitely called for here.

Hopefully we'll be going out sometime next week.

Shaolin Soccer Its Crouching Tiger meets UEFA. I especially like the part where she uses the shaolin force to parallel park her car. and for a more serious movie, this shows some prospect. Marooned in Iraq. and ok, I know I can be dorky (I embrace it lovingly) but I thought this was cool when I read it. The Holy Land is about a young rabbincal student in TA who falls in love with a girl, meets an American photojournalist and ends up at a bar in Jerusalem called 'Mike's Place'. The cool part? well here are pictures of me at that very bar! ok, resume your lives... there's nothing to see here.

This is from a second IAF attack on Hamas that happened Wednesday. 3 people killed 2 from Hamas. In a separate attack that same day 7 Palestinians were killed, 3 were members of Hamas. This is the picture of Sgt. Tamar Ben-Eliahu, a 19 year old woman who was killed in the Hamas bombing of bus 19 on Jaffa St in Jerusalem today.

This is what your car would look like if it was hit with a barrage of sidewinder missiles. "Can we be any further from peace in the middle east then the shootout at the Church of the Nativity? Can it be any more obvious then when youre doing the Starsky and Hutch 'shoulder-roll' behind the frankincense holder left by the Magi. What is this? The shootout at the oy-vey corral?" - Dennis Miller

Interviewed with GLSEN today. They told me it would be a full time job in DC and would pay $250 a week. Thats just enough for me to survive. Its apparently a small office with a staff of 4 people. Part of my job would be researching state statues regarding the glbt community. They told me they would have a decision by the end of the week. 

My only fear is that I was too nervous on the phone. I hope that doesnt blow it for me. 

wish me luck, light a candle, kill a chicken, whatever it is you do...

First of all, Rise of Nations is EVIL. 
Spent way too many hours playing that game. 

Onto more important things: GLSEN called today to reschedule my interview for tomorrow at 2PM, another night in suspense.

The recruiter called me to see if i had decided on something, I  told him it would take another day. 

Nothing from Target or Florida Hospital.
